00475 #ifndef _MIDAS_H_
00476 #define _MIDAS_H_

00478 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00479 
00480 /* MIDAS library version number. This value is returned by 
00481    cm_get_version and will be incremented whenever changes are done
00482    to the MIDAS library. First digit is major release, second
00483    digit is minor release, third digit is patch level */
00484 
00506 #define MIDAS_VERSION "1.9.5"
00507 #define DATABASE_VERSION 2   /* has to be changed whenenver binary ODB format changes*/
00508 
00510 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
00511 
00512 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00513 
00514 /* find out on which operating system we are running */
00515 
00516 #if defined( VAX ) || defined( __VMS )
00517 #define OS_VMS
00518 #endif
00519 
00520 #if defined( _MSC_VER )
00521 #define OS_WINNT
00522 #endif
00523 
00524 #if defined( __MSDOS__ )
00525 #define OS_MSDOS
00526 #endif
00527 
00528 #if defined ( vxw )
00529 #define OS_VXWORKS
00530 #undef OS_UNIX
00531 #endif
00532 
00533 #if !defined(OS_LINUX)
00534 #if defined ( __linux__ )
00535 #define OS_LINUX
00536 #endif
00537 #endif
00538 
00539 #if defined(OS_LINUX) || defined(OS_OSF1) || defined(OS_ULTRIX) || defined(OS_FREEBSD) || defined(OS_SOLARIS) || defined(OS_IRIX) || defined(OS_DARWIN)
00540 #define OS_UNIX
00541 #endif
00542 
00543 #if !defined(OS_IRIX) && !defined(OS_VMS) && !defined(OS_MSDOS) && !defined(OS_UNIX) && !defined(OS_VXWORKS) && !defined(OS_WINNT)
00544 #error MIDAS cannot be used on this operating system
00545 #endif
00546 
00547 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00548 
00549 #ifdef USE_ROOT
00550 #include <TObjArray.h>
00551 #include <TFolder.h>
00552 #include <TCutG.h>
00553 #endif
00554 
00555 /* Define basic data types */
00556 
00557 #ifndef MIDAS_TYPE_DEFINED
00558 #define MIDAS_TYPE_DEFINED
00559 
00560 typedef unsigned char BYTE;
00561 typedef unsigned short int WORD;
00562 
00563 #if defined(__alpha) || defined(__x86_64__)
00564 typedef unsigned int DWORD;
00565 #else
00566 typedef unsigned long int DWORD;
00567 #endif
00568 
00569 #ifndef OS_WINNT
00570 #ifndef OS_VXWORKS
00571 typedef DWORD BOOL;
00572 #endif
00573 #endif
00574 
00575 #endif                          /* MIDAS_TYPE_DEFINED */
00576 
00577 /*
00578   Definitions depending on integer types:
00579 
00580   Note that the alpha chip uses 32 bit integers by default.
00581   Therefore always use 'INT' instead 'int'.
00582 */
00583 #if defined(OS_MSDOS)
00584 typedef long int INT;
00585 #elif defined( OS_WINNT )
00586 
00587 /* INT predefined in windows.h */
00588 #ifndef _INC_WINDOWS
00589 #include <windows.h>
00590 #endif
00591 
00592 #else
00593 typedef int INT;
00594 #endif
00595 
00596 typedef INT HNDLE;
00597 
00598 /* Include vxWorks for BOOL definition */
00599 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
00600 #ifndef __INCvxWorksh
00601 #include <vxWorks.h>
00602 #endif
00603 #endif
00604 
00605 /*
00606   Definitions depending on pointer types:
00607 
00608   Note that the alpha chip uses 64 bit pointers by default.
00609   Therefore, when converting pointer to integers, always
00610   use the (PTYPE) cast.
00611 */
00612 #if defined(__alpha) || defined(__x86_64__)
00613 #define PTYPE              long int
00614 #else
00615 #define PTYPE              int
00616 #endif
00617 
00618 /* need system-dependant thread type */
00619 #if defined(OS_WINNT)
00620 typedef HANDLE midas_thread_t;
00621 #elif defined(OS_UNIX)
00622 #include <pthread.h>
00623 typedef pthread_t midas_thread_t;
00624 #else
00625 typedef INT midas_thread_t;
00626 #endif
00627 
00628 #define TRUE  1
00629 #define FALSE 0
00630 
00631 /* directory separator */
00632 #if defined(OS_MSDOS) || defined(OS_WINNT)
00633 #define DIR_SEPARATOR     '\\'
00634 #define DIR_SEPARATOR_STR "\\"
00635 #elif defined(OS_VMS)
00636 #define DIR_SEPARATOR     ']'
00637 #define DIR_SEPARATOR_STR "]"
00638 #else
00639 #define DIR_SEPARATOR     '/'
00640 #define DIR_SEPARATOR_STR "/"
00641 #endif
00642 
00643 /* inline functions */
00644 #if defined( _MSC_VER )
00645 #define INLINE __inline
00646 #elif defined(__GNUC__)
00647 #define INLINE __inline__
00648 #else
00649 #define INLINE
00650 #endif
00651 
00652 /* large file (>2GB) support */
00653 #ifndef _LARGEFILE64_SOURCE
00654 #define O_LARGEFILE 0
00655 #endif
00656 
00658 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
00659 
00660 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00661 
00662 /* Definition of implementation specific constants */
00663

01529    DWORD previous_count;
01530    BOOL value;
01531 } ANA_TEST;
01532 
01533 #define SET_TEST(t, v) { if (!t.registered) test_register(&t); t.value = (v); }
01534 #define TEST(t) (t.value)
01535 
01536 #ifdef DEFINE_TESTS
01537 #define DEF_TEST(t) ANA_TEST t = { #t, 0, 0, FALSE };
01538 #else
01539 #define DEF_TEST(t) extern ANA_TEST t;

02269 #ifdef USE_ROOT
02270    /* root functions really are C++ functions */
02271    extern TFolder *gManaHistosFolder;
02272    extern TObjArray *gHistoFolderStack;
02273 
02274    // book functions put a root object in a suitable folder
02275    // for histos, there are a lot of types, so we use templates.
02276    // for other objects we have one function per object
02277    template<typename TH1X>
02278    TH1X EXPRT *h1_book(const char *name, const char *title,
02279                        int bins, double min, double max)
02280    {
02281       TH1X *hist;
02282 
02283       /* check if histo already exists */
02284       if (!gHistoFolderStack->Last())
02285          hist = (TH1X *) gManaHistosFolder->FindObjectAny(name);
02286       else
02287          hist = (TH1X *) ((TFolder *)gHistoFolderStack->Last())->FindObjectAny(name);
02288 
02289       if (hist == NULL) {
02290          hist = new TH1X(name, title, bins, min, max);
02291          if (!gHistoFolderStack->Last())
02292             gManaHistosFolder->Add(hist);
02293          else
02294             ((TFolder *)gHistoFolderStack->Last())->Add(hist);
02295       }
02296 
02297       return hist;
02298    }
02299 
02300    template<typename TH1X>
02301    TH1X EXPRT *h1_book(const char *name, const char *title,
02302                        int bins, double edges[])
02303    {
02304       TH1X *hist;
02305 
02306       /* check if histo already exists */
02307       if (!gHistoFolderStack->Last())
02308          hist = (TH1X *) gManaHistosFolder->FindObjectAny(name);
02309       else
02310          hist = (TH1X *) ((TFolder *)gHistoFolderStack->Last())->FindObjectAny(name);
02311 
02312       if (hist == NULL) {
02313          hist = new TH1X(name, title, bins, edges);
02314          if (!gHistoFolderStack->Last())
02315             gManaHistosFolder->Add(hist);
02316          else
02317             ((TFolder *)gHistoFolderStack->Last())->Add(hist);
02318       }
02319 
02320       return hist;
02321    }

02419    /*
02420     * the following two macros allow for simple fortran like usage
02421     * for the most common histo types
02422     */
02423    #define H1_BOOK(n,t,b,min,max) (h1_book<TH1F>(n,t,b,min,max))
02424    #define H2_BOOK(n,t,xb,xmin,xmax,yb,ymin,ymax) (h2_book<TH2F>(n,t,xb,xmin,xmax,yb,ymin,ymax))
